content.body: This may be a strange question, but what is this group about? I'm new to Matrix and don't really know what it is lol
Is there a meaningful difference between an `optional any` argument being *missing* vs being *undefined*? https://github.com/WebAssembly/spec/issues/1861
content.formatted_body: Is there a meaningful difference between an optional any argument being missing vs being undefined? https://github.com/WebAssembly/spec/issues/1861

content.body: If I make WebAssembly.Global's constructor check how many arguments are in the VM, I fail 3 tests. But If I just treat missing as undefined, it agrees with the other three engines ðŸ¤”
* Is there a meaningful difference between an `optional any` argument being _missing_ vs being the value `undefined`? https://github.com/WebAssembly/spec/issues/1861
content.formatted_body: * Is there a meaningful difference between an optional any argument being missing vs being the value undefined? https://github.com/WebAssembly/spec/issues/1861

content.body: i interpreted the difference as being `foo()` vs `foo(undefined)`
content.formatted_body: i interpreted the difference as being foo() vs foo(undefined)

content.body: right.. in this case, everyone is treating `new WebAssembly.Global({ value: "f64" })` the same as `new WebAssembly.Global({ value: "f64", undefined)`
content.formatted_body: right.. in this case, everyone is treating new WebAssembly.Global({ value: "f64" }) the same as new WebAssembly.Global({ value: "f64", undefined)
